intro: Patrocles, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. The plant features dark green, palmately lobed leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in umbels, typically blooming in early spring. Patrocles is often found in moist, shaded woodlands and can grow up to 2-3 feet tall.
